INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS COMMUNITY-DIRECTED GRANT PROGRAM - THE LOWER SIOUX INDIAN COMMUNITY (LSIC) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE LOCATED IN SOUTH CENTRAL MINNESOTA IN REDWOOD COUNTY, APPROXIMATELY TWO MILES SOUTH OF MORTON AND 100 MILES FROM THE MINNEAPOLIS ST. PAUL METRO AREA. APPROXIMATELY 145 FAMILIES LIVE ON 1,743 ACRES OF TRIBAL LAND. AS OF JANUARY 2020, LSIC HAS A TOTAL OF 1,272 ENROLLED MEMBERS. OVER 80% OF WHICH LIVE ON THE LOWER SIOUX RESERVATION OR WITHIN THE 10-MILE FEDERALLY NEGOTIATED SERVICE AREA THAT SPANS THREE COUNTIES. FIFTY-THREE PERCENT OF OUR MEMBERS ARE UNDER 25 YEARS OF AGE, INDICATING A GROWING POPULATION. THE LOWER SIOUX COMMUNITY IS LOCATED 6 MILES FROM THE CENTRACARE HOSPITAL, WHICH IS CLASSIFIED AS A CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL WITH 18 INPATIENT BEDS. LOWER SIOUX COMMUNITY MEMBERS ALSO UTILIZE A VARIETY OF SPECIALTY CLINICS WITHIN A 100-MILE RADIUS, BUT THE MAJORITY UTILIZE OUR TRIBAL RUN CLINIC, THE LOWER SIOUX HEALTH CARE CENTER, WHICH OPENED IN MARCH 2016. UPON OPENING OF THE LOWER SIOUX HEALTHCARE CENTER, THE SDPI PROGRAM HAS BEEN AND CONTINUES TO BE HOUSED AND ADMINISTERED DIRECTLY IN THE CLINIC. THEREFORE, FOR THE FIRST TIME IN THE HISTORY OF THE LOWER SIOUX COMMUNITY, WE HAVE HAD DIRECT CLINICAL ACCESS TO OUR COMMUNITY MEMBER'S MEDICAL INFORMATION AND CARE. THE TARGET GROUP THE SDPI COORDINATOR WILL PLAN TO SERVE AND REPORT RKM DATA INCLUDE THOSE LOWER SIOUX COMMUNITY MEMBERS, LIVING WITHIN THE 10-MILE SERVICE AREA OF THE RESERVATION, BETWEEN THE AGES OF 25 TO 65 WITH DIABETES AND PREDIABETES WHO PARTICIPATE IN MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY (MNT) AND NUTRITION EDUCATION COMMUNITY EVENTS.  THE TARGET GROUP HAS BEEN DETERMINED BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS WITHIN A GROUP THAT HAVE EXHIBITED TO PRESENT THE LARGEST CHALLENGE AS IT RELATES TO ACCEPTANCE OF THEIR DIABETES DIAGNOSIS. THEREFORE, MANY IN THIS POPULATION HAVE SHOWN TO BE NON -COMPLIANT WITH THEIR MEDICATION MANAGEMENT AS WELL AS NOT MAKING LIFESTYLE CHANGES SUCH AS DIET AND EXERCISE CENTERED ON IMPROVING THEIR OVERAL L HEALTH AND AVOIDING DIABETES RELATED COMPLICATIONS.  THE GOALS INCLUDED IN THE PROJECT PROPOSAL INCLUDE INCREASING THE NUMBER AND PERCENT OF THOSE IN THE TARGET GROUP WHO RECEIVE NUTRITION EDUCATION. A SUMMARY OF THE LOWER SIOUX SDPI PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDES CONDUCTING INDIVIDUAL MNT BY THE SDPI COORDINATOR/REGISTERED DIETITIAN TO THOSE IN THE TARGET POPULATION. FURTHER PROGRAMMING WILL INCLUDE, A VARIETY OF NUTRITION LEARNING ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS COLLABORATION WITH OTHER COMMUNITY HEALTH PROGRAMMING SUCH AS, A SERIES OF COOKING CLASSES DESIGNED TO BRING IN FAMILIES TO CREATE A QUICK, HEALTHY MEAL TOGETHER TO ASSIST COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THE TARGET POPULATION WITH DIABETES OR PREDIABETES IN BECOMING MORE EDUCATED IN HEALTHY MEAL PLANNING. NUTRITION EDUCATION WILL ALSO BE EMBEDDED INTO PHYSICAL ACTIVITY PROGRAMMING BY THE SDPI COORDINATOR/RDN. EVALUATION STRATEGIES WILL INCLUDE A MIXED METHOD FRAMEWORK UTILIZED TO MEASURE READINESS FOR CHANGE AND ACCEPTABILITY OF INTERVENTION COMPONENTS AMONGST THOSE IN THE TARGET POPULATION. IN SUMMARY, THE INTENT OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE LSIC MEMBERS IN THE TARGET POPULATION OPTIMAL NUTRITION EDUCATION AND DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT TOOLS TO ASSIST IN POSITIVE OVERALL DIABETES RELATED HEALTH OUTCOMES.
LAC VIEUX DESERT BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS SPDPI 2023 - SDPI PROGRAM TO PROVIDE EYE AND FOOT EXAMS FOR AI/AN PATIENTS OF THE LAC VIEUX DESERT HEALTH CENTER.

LAC COURTE OREILLES SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS - THE LAC COURTE OREILLES BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER OF HAYWARD, WISCONSIN’S WOULD LIKE TO SUBMIT THIS APPLICATION FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS GRANT PROGRAM FY 2023 (FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: HHS-2023-HIS-SDPI-0001). 	 LAC COURTE OREILLES TRIBE HAS AN ENROLLMENT OF 8,214 MEMBERS OF WHICH APPROXIMATELY 4,200 LIVE ON OR NEAR THE RESERVATION.  THE RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN RURAL SAWYER COUNTY, WISCONSIN, APPROXIMATELY 90 MILES SOUTHEAST OF DULUTH, MINNESOTA AND 8 MILES EAST OF HAYWARD, WISCONSIN, WHICH IS THE COUNTY SEAT.  THE RESERVATION INCLUDES APPROXIMATELY 15 SQUARE MILE AND CONSISTS OF 25 SEPARATE COMMUNITIES SCATTERED WITHIN ITS BORDERS.  A NUMBER OF COMMUNITIES ARE 30 OR MORE MILES FROM THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER.  ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND HEALTHY AFFORDABLE FOODS IS CHALLENGED BY DISTANCE AND INCLEMENT WEATHER, ESPECIALLY DURING THE HARSH WINTERS. 	THE LCO DIABETES PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAM IS LOCATED WITHIN THE LAC COURTE OREILLES COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER’S TRIBAL CLINIC IN THE CENTER OF THE RESERVATION, NEXT TO THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OFFICES AND SCHOOLS.  THE DIABETES PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAM IS ACCREDITED THROUGH THE ASSOCIATION OF DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SPECIALISTS (ADCES).  THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER IS ACCREDITED BY THE ACCREDITATION ASSOCIATION FOR AMBULATORY HEALTH CARE (AAAHC). 	THE PRIMARY DIABETES TEAM INCLUDES A HEALTH COACH, REGISTERED NURSE DIABETES EDUCATOR, AND REGISTERED DIETITIAN WHO IS ALSO A CERTIFIED DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SPECIALIST.   OUR EXPANDED TEAM ALSO INCLUDES MEDICAL AND NURSING STAFF, A PODIATRIST, DENTAL HYGIENIST, AND IMMUNIZATIONS COORDINATOR. 	THE MAJOR GOALS FOR THE GRANT PROJECT ARE TO: 1. PROVIDE EDUCATION TO INDIVIDUALS AND GROUPS AT THE CLINIC AND ELSEWHERE ON THE RESERVATION.  THIS EDUCATION WILL INCLUDE DIABETES PREVENTION AND TREATMENT PROVIDED AT EACH CLIENT’S LEARNING LEVEL.  2. PROVIDE SCREENING AND SUPPORT INTERVENTIONS WHICH PREVENT COMPLICATIONS. 3. IMPROVE IMMUNIZATION RATES FOR THE CLINIC’S PATIENTS WITH DIABETES 4. HELP CLIENTS MAKE SIMPLE, HEALTHY FOOD AND EXERCISE LIFESTYLE CHOICES THEY CAN LIVE WITH. 	THE PRIMARY IMPACT OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO PROVIDE THE LCO RESERVATION WITH RESOURCES TO TREAT DIABETES, PREVENT COMPLICATIONS CAUSED BY DIABETES AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND SUPPORT TO TRIBAL MEMBERS ABOUT DIABETES AND DIABETES PREVENTION.

LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE DIABETES TREATMENT AND PREVENTION PROGRAM - APPLICATION FOR FUNDING IN ORDER TO DELIVER DIABETES EDUCATION, DIABETES CARE AND DIABETES PREVENTION SERVICES TO TRIBAL MEMBERS.  THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER THE ONGOING GOAL OF EMPOWERING THOSE THAT HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH DIABETES AND PREDIABETES WITH THE KNOWLEDGE THEY NEED TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS REGARDING THEIR DIABETES CARE AND MANAGEMENT.

LAC DU FLAMBEAU DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION PROGRAM - DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION HAS BEEN OCCURRING IN LAC DU FLAMBEAU WISCONSIN SINCE 1996. THE TRIBE HAS BEEN A RECIPIENT OF THE SDPI GRANT SINCE 1998. THE DIABETES PROGRAM CURRENTLY HAS TWO CERTIFIED DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SPECIALISTS (CDCES). THEY PROVIDE INDIVIDUAL DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SERVICES TO PATIENTS OF THE LOCAL TRIBAL CLINIC- PETER CHRISTENSEN HEALTH CENTER. THE DIABETES PROGRAM INCLUDES COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE CDCES’S AND THE MEDICAL TEAM TO PROVIDE PROPER DIABETES CARE. THE PROGRAM IS ACCREDITED BY THE ASSOCIATION OF DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SPECIALISTS. THIS REQUIRES CONTINUAL QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND EVIDENCE OF FOLLOWING THE STANDARDS OF DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SET FORTH BY ADCES. PATIENTS ARE OFTEN REFERRED TO INTERNAL OR EXTERNAL HEALTH AND MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAM AS NEEDED. THE CDCES’S COLLABORATE WITH OTHER HEALTH PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE DIABETES EDUCATION AT COMMUNITY EVENTS.

LTBB SDPI FY 2023 - THE LITTLE TRAVERSE BAY BANDS OF ODAWA INDIANS' 60-MONTH SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS (SDPI) WILL PROMOTE DIABETES EDUCATION, CARE AND PREVENTION THROUGH THE IHS BEST PRACTICE OF DIABETES-RELATED EDUCATION. THE REQUIRED KEY MEASURE IS THE NUMBER AND PERCENT OF INDIVIDUALS IN OUR TARGET GROUP WHO RECEIVE EDUCATION ON ANY DIABETES TOPIC, EITHER IN A GROUP OR INDIVIDUAL SETTING. DIABETES-RELATED EDUCATION ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SELF-GUIDED WELLNESS PLANS, LIFESTYLE EDUCATION, NUTRITION EDUCATION, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EDUCATION, COMMUNITY EVENTS, AND THE HOME-GROWN PROJECT. OTHER ACTIVITIES/SERVICES NOT RELATED TO OUR BEST PRACTICE ARE USE OF TRADITIONAL HEALERS AND YOUTH-BASED DIABETES-RELATED EDUCATION.

SCITSDPI23 - THE SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS FUNDING, APPLIED FOR BY THE SAGINAW CHIPPEWA INDIAN TRIBE OF MICHIGAN, WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION, CLINICAL TREATMENT GOALS AS WELL AS PREVENTION EFFORTS OF DIABETES COMPLICATIONS. IN ADDITION, THE IHS DIABETES CARE AND OUTCOMES AUDIT AND SMALL-SCALE COMMUNITY SURVEY OF HEALTH CONCERNS WERE REVIEWED BY DIABETES PROGRAM STAFF. INFORMATION AND DATA GATHERED FROM THESE AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS ARE VIEWED AS VITAL IN STEERING THE PROGRAM’S VISION FOR THE NIMKEE MEMORIAL WELLNESS CENTER DIABETES PROGRAM.  VALUED OUTCOMES ARE USED IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF CLINICAL INTERVENTIONS THAT ASSIST CLIENTS IN GAINING KNOWLEDGE FOR DIABETES CARE AND PREVENTION OF DIABETES-RELATED COMPLICATIONS, DISEASE MANAGEMENT AND SELF-EFFICACY WHILE BEING RESPECTFUL OF CULTURAL TRADITIONS AND VALUES.  THE SAGINAW CHIPPEWA SPECIAL DIABETES PROJECT GOALS ARE TO EMPOWER PATIENTS WITH THE TOOLS FOR DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT, ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NUMBER OF CLINICAL ACTIVITIES AND SERVICES.  IMPLEMENTING BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP EDUCATION SESSIONS THAT WILL GUIDE IMPROVEMENTS IN SELF-MANAGEMENT SKILLS FOR DIABETES PATIENTS. USING A TEAM APPROACH OF CLINICAL AND PHARMACEUTICAL MANAGEMENT ALONG WITH INDIVIDUALIZED DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT SUPPORT, BOTH SHORT AND LONG TERM GOALS WILL BE IDENTIFIED WITH THE PATIENT THAT ARE INDIVIDUALIZED, MEASURABLE AND ACHIEVABLE. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON PREVENTING DIABETES COMPLICATIONS OF THE DIABETIC FOOT AND EYE, GUIDED BY EVIDENCED-BASED STANDARDS.  PROJECT EVALUATION TOOLS WILL BE QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE USING ESTABLISHED TOOLS FOR EVALUATION THROUGH THE IHS DIABETES CARE AND OUTCOMES AUDIT, ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD, SDPI OUTCOME SYSTEM, EXCEL SPREADSHEETS, PRE/POST TESTS AND OPEN-ENDED QUESTION SURVEYS. THIS PROJECT FUNDING WILL ENABLE THE SAGINAW CHIPPEWA INDIAN TRIBAL DIABETES PROGRAM TO ENGAGE DIABETES CLIENTS IN DIRECT CLINICAL AND GROUP INTERVENTION MEASURES AIDING IN PROGRESSION TOWARDS SELF-MANAGEMENT BY INVOLVING THE CLIENT-PROVIDER, CLIENT-HEALTHCARE TEAM, CLIENT-HEALTHCARE SYSTEM AND TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR IMPROVED CLINICAL OUTCOMES IN DIABETES CARE AND PREVENTION OF DIABETES-RELATED COMPLICATIONS.

MENOMINEE SDPI PROGRAM - THIS PROJECT, USING GLYCEMIC CONTROL AS ITS BEST PRACTICE ALLOWS OUR PROGRAM TO PROVIDE PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND TERTIARY CARE FOR THE PATIENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF THE MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN. INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT FOR THE TARGET GROUP OF 30 RANDOMLY SELECTED PATIENTS WITH AN A1C OVER 9 PERCENT WILL BE PROVIDED BY PROGRAM STAFF. THE GOAL FOR THE INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS OF THIS TARGET GROUP IS TO LOWER THEIR A1C TO LESS THAN 8 PERCENT AND THUS WILL IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH OUTCOMES.  ADDITIONAL SUPPORT/SERVICES BEING OFFERED THROUGH THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE PATIENT ACCESS TO A PODIATRIST, A REGISTERED NURSE TO PROVIDE WOUND CARE IF NEEDED, OPTICAL SERVICES TO DETECT RETINOPATHY AND A DENTAL HYGIENIST TO SUPPORT DENTAL CARE FOR THE TARGET GROUP. THE PODIATRIST WILL BE AVAILABLE TWO DAYS PER MONTH TO SEE DIABETIC PATIENTS. THE REMAINING SUPPORT SPECIALISTS ARE REGULAR EMPLOYEES OF THE CLINIC AND WILL BE AVAILABLE THROUGHOUT THE GRANT PERIOD. DIABETES PATIENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO ACCESS SMOKING CESSATION SUPPORT, DIABETES EDUCATION ACTIVITIES AND REGULAR COMMUNITY-BASED EXERCISE PROGRAMS.  THE DIABETES PROGRAM WILL ALSO FOCUS DIABETES PREVENTION EFFORTS ON THE YOUTH IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING AFTER SCHOOL PHYSICAL ACTIVITY PROGRAMS. THIS AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM WILL ALSO CONTAIN A HEALTHY BEHAVIOR EDUCATIONAL COMPONENT WITH TOPICS SUCH AS DIABETES PREVENTION, EATING HEALTHY FOOD, MAINTAINING PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, NOT SMOKING, AVOIDING DRUG USE AND INDIVIDUAL WELL BEING.

HEALTHY IS A HO-CHUNK TRADITION - THE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELLNESS DIVISION OVERSEES THE SDPI GRANT WHICH FOCUSES ON CULTURALLY-CENTERED APPROACHES TO HEALTHY LIFESTYLES. OUR PRIMARY OBJECTIVES ARE TO OFFER COURSES OF NUTRITION EDUCATION AND EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY WHICH ENCOURAGES HEALTHY MEAL PREPARATION AND ACTIVITY. WE SET GOALS FOR OUR PARTICIPANTS TO LOSE 5-7% OF THEIR TOTAL BODY WEIGHT TO REDUCE THE LIKELIHOOD OF DIABETES AND/OR PRE-DIABETES. WE ALSO ADD TRADITIONAL AND LOCALLY SOURCED FOOD SYSTEMS TO PROMOTE STRONG CULTURAL IDENTITIES AND CONFIDENCE IN HEALTHY LIFESTYLES.

RED CLIFF SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS INITIATIVE PROVIDES PRO-ACTIVE SUPPORTIVE CARE TO THOSE LIVING WITH AND AT HIGH RISK FOR DEVELOPING DIABETES. - THE RED CLIFF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER IS A PATIENT-CENTERED MEDICAL HOME CLINIC. WE HAVE A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES AT THE CLINIC TO HELP CARE AND TREAT OUR PATIENTS WITH DIABETES. WE ALSO OFFER MANY PREVENTIVE SERVICES TO HELP REDUCE THE RISK OF PATIENTS BECOMING DIABETIC. THERE IS A LAB ON SITE WHICH ALLOWS PATIENTS TO BE ABLE TO RECEIVE LAB DRAWS AT THEIR APPOINTMENTS WITH THEIR PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN. WE DO CONTRACT WITH PODIATRIST AND REGISTERED DIETITIAN, THEY PROVIDER SERVICES TO OUR PATIENTS MONTHLY. AT THE RED CLIFF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER, WE US A MAX PACKING APPROACH AT PATIENTS’ APPOINTMENTS WHICH MEANS WHEN A PATIENT COMES INTO THE CLINIC FOR ANY TYPE OF APPOINTMENT WEATHER FOR AN ACUTE OR CHRONIC ISSUE, WE MAKE SURE THEY ARE UP TO DATE ON ALL THEIR LABS, IMMUNIZATIONS, SCREENING ETC. THE RED CLIFF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER HOSTS MANY EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, A HEALTH FAIR AND A SPRING AND FALL FEST.  AT THESE EVENTS THERE ARE EDUCATIONAL TABLES, SCREENINGS SUCH AS A1C, CHOLESTEROL, HEALTHY FOOD OPTION DEMONSTRATIONS, AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES. THE RED CLIFF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER HAS BEEN RECEIVING THE SDPI GRANT SINCE 2010, THE GRANT HAS MADE IT POSSIBLE FOR THE CLINIC TO BE ABLE TO OFFER MANY OF THE SERVICES NAMED ABOVE.

BAY MILLS DIABETES TREATMENT AND PREVENTION PROGRAM - BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY IS IN MICHIGAN’S UPPER PENINSULA ON THE EASTERN SHORES OF LAKE SUPERIOR NEAR THE CANADIAN BORDER.  BAY MILLS HEALTH CENTER, THE HOME BASE FOR THE DIABETES PROGRAM, WAS DEDICATED AS THE ELLEN MARSHALL MEMORIAL CENTER IN 1998.  ELLEN MARSHALL WAS A TRADITIONAL HEALER AND MIDWIFE AT THE TURN OF THE 20TH CENTURY.  SHE SERVED NOT ONLY THE BAY MILLS TRIBE, BUT THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AS WELL.  THE HEALTH CENTER HAS CONTINUED TO HONOR THIS SAME TRADITION BY PROVIDING SERVICES TO ANY COUNTY RESIDENT WISHING TO ESTABLISH CARE.  BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY IS IN A RURAL, MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREA.  DESPITE THIS, THE TRIBE’S HEALTH CENTER PROVIDES MANY BASIC MEDICAL SERVICES, WHICH IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT SINCE THE NEAREST LOCATION WITH SIMILAR SERVICES IS AT LEAST 20 MILES EAST IN SAULT SAINTE MARIE, A TOWN OF ABOUT 13,000 RESIDENTS.  TO MEET THE EVER-EXPANDING NEEDS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, BAY MILLS HEALTH CENTER MOVED INTO A NEW FACILITY IN APRIL 2022.  THE NEW BUILDING OFFERS PRIMARY CARE SERVICES WITH A FULL-TIME STAFF OF ONE PHYSICIAN AND THREE CERTIFIED FAMILY NURSE PRACTITIONERS.  A TRADITIONAL HEALER NOW HOLDS PART-TIME HOURS IN THE MEDICAL CLINIC AS WELL.  DENTAL, PHARMACY, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, AND SOCIAL SERVICES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE.  OPTOMETRY IS A MUCH NEEDED AND NEWLY ADDED SERVICE.  A COMMUNITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT FULFILLS A VARIETY OF NEEDS, INCLUDING DIABETES EDUCATION AND SUPPORT, COMMUNITY AND EMPLOYEE VACCINATIONS, HEALTHY START AND TRIBAL HOME VISITING, MANAGEMENT OF THE BAY MILLS FARMER’S MARKET, AND PATIENT TRANSPORTATION.  BAY MILLS HAS RECEIVED FUNDING FROM SDPI SINCE 1998.  IT HAS BENEFITED THE COMMUNITY IN MANY WAYS.  IT HAS GIVEN THE HEALTH CENTER THE FINANCIAL MEANS TO HIRE QUALIFIED MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS (I.E., REGISTERED NURSE AND REGISTERED DIETITIAN) TO EDUCATE AND SUPPORT TRIBAL MEMBERS IN DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT CARE (SEE BEST PRACTICE OF DIABETES-RELATED EDUCATION IN PART D OF THE PROJECT NARRATIVE).  SDPI DOLLARS HAVE ALSO PAID FOR CONTINUING MEDICAL EDUCATION SO THAT THESE PROFESSIONALS CAN KEEP CURRENT WITH THE LATEST ADVANCES IN THIS FIELD.  FUNDING IN 2023 WILL CONTINUE TO BE USED TO SUPPORT SDPI KEY PERSONNEL POSITIONS AND ALSO FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION.  ANOTHER SERVICE THE BAY MILLS SDPI PROGRAM HAS CONTRIBUTED STAFF TIME TO IS COMMUNITY VACCINATION CLINICS TO PREVENT ILLNESSES SUCH AS INFLUENZA AND COVID-19, WHICH MAY CAUSE MORE SEVERE COMPLICATIONS IN PEOPLE WITH DIABETES.  IN THE PAST, SDPI KEY PERSONNEL HAVE BEEN INSTRUMENTAL IN ACHIEVING AN 83% FLU VACCINATION RATE ON THE 2021 ANNUAL DIABETES AUDIT REPORT.  THIS WAS THE HIGHEST PERCENTAGE IN THE PREVIOUS 14 YEARS OF AUDIT DATA FOR BAY MILLS.  THIS WORK WILL CONTINUE IN 2023 (SEE ACTIVITY/SERVICE #1 REGARDING FLU IMMUNIZATIONS IN PART E OF THE PROJECT NARRATIVE) WITH THE ADDITION OF THE PNEUMOVAX VACCINE TO COMMUNITY FLU CLINICS TO IMPROVE DATA FOR THE ANNUAL DIABETES AUDIT REPORT (SEE PROJECT NARRATIVE PART B).  SDPI FUNDING HAS ALSO BEEN USED TO PURCHASE A NUMBER OF TYPES OF PRODUCTS TO SUPPORT DIABETES CARE.  ONE TYPE OF PRODUCT IS GLUCOSE TESTING SUPPLIES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS SINCE THE HEALTH CENTER’S PHARMACY DOES NOT HAVE A DURABLE MEDICAL EQUIPMENT LICENSE TO BILL INSURANCE FOR THEM AND THE 20-MILE DISTANCE BETWEEN BAY MILLS AND THE NEAREST PHARMACY ABLE TO PROVIDE THIS SERVICE PRESENTS A CHALLENGE FOR SOME PEOPLE.  SUPPLIES FOR FOOT CARE RELATED TO BEST PRACTICE ACTIVITY # 3 (SEE PROJECT NARRATIVE PART D) AND FARMER’S MARKET COUPONS FOR BAY MILLS MEMBERS ACTIVE WITH THEIR DIABETES CARE AT THE HEALTH CENTER ARE AMONG OTHER ITEMS SDPI FUNDING HAS BEEN AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE USED FOR IN 2023.  OVER THE PAST 25 YEARS, SDPI HAS PROVIDED BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY WITH A TREMENDOUS AMOUNT OF SUPPORT, BOTH FINANCIALLY AND FROM A PROGRAMMATIC STANDPOINT WITH EXPERTISE FROM A NUMBER OF PAST BEMIDJI AREA DIABETES CONSULTANTS.  THIS HAS HELPED BUILD AND SHAPE THE PROGRAM INTO THE SUCCESS IT IS TODAY.

GUN LAKE TRIBE SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS - THE GUN LAKE TRIBE HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT WILL PROVIDE DIABETES RELATED CARE FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY THROUGH PARTNERING WITH A REGISTERED DIETITIAN, OFFERING PROFESSIONAL AND PERSONAL CONTINUOUS GLUCOSE MONITORING THERAPY, PROVIDING NUTRITION INFORMATION, AND OFFERING A DIABETES SUPPORT GROUP WITH NUTRITION FOCUSED ACTIVITIES.

HANNAHVILLE'S SDPI DIABETES PROGRAM - THE HANNAHVILLE INDIAN COMMUNITY IS LOCATED IN A VERY RURAL AND REMOTE ARE OF THE UPPER PENINSULA OF MICHIGAN ON APPROXIMATELY 6,000 ACRES OF RESERVATION LAND. APPROXIMATELY 850 TRIBAL MEMBERS AND DESCENDANTS LIVE ON OR NEAR THE RESERVATION AND SEEK SERVICES FROM WITHIN THE RESERVATION COMMUNITY. THE SDPI PROGRAM HAS OPERATED WITHIN OUR TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR 24 YEARS. OUR PROGRAM OPERATES WITHIN OUR TRIBAL HEALTH CLINIC AND ALL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES ARE IMPLEMENTED BY OUR DIETITIAN/DIABETES COORDINATOR WHO HAS 25 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE AS AN REGISTERED DIETITIAN. OUR DIETITIAN/DIABETES COORDINATOR WORKS CLOSELY WITH OUR MEDICAL PROVIDERS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR DIABETIC POPULATION. THE SDPI DIABETES BEST PRACTICE OUR PROGRAM FOCUSES ON IS NUTRITION EDUCATION. THIS FOCUS AREA ALLOWS OUR PROGRAM TO MAKE THE MOST IMPACT WITH OUR CLIENTELE. GOOD NUTRITION IS AN ESSENTIAL PART OF MAINTAINING A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE.  IT IS IMPORTANT FOR, AND AFFECTS EVERY PERSON OF ALL AGES, AND IS A KEY COMPONENT IN THE MANAGEMENT AND PREVENTION OF DIABETES. THERE ARE MANY CREATIVE AND ENGAGING WAYS TO PROVIDE NUTRITION EDUCATION AND OUR DIABETES PROGRAM COORDINATOR HAS EXPERTISE IN PROVIDING SOUND NUTRITION INFORMATION FOR HEALTH AND DISEASE PREVENTION.

SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS POKAGON BAND OF POTAWATOMI - FOR ITS FY 2023 SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS (SDPI), THE POKAGON BAND OF POTAWATOMI INDIANS (“POKAGON BAND”) PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT DEPRESSION SCREENING AS ITS BEST PRACTICE. PEOPLE WITH DIABETES ARE TWO TO THREE TIMES MORE LIKELY TO HAVE DEPRESSION THAN PEOPLE WITHOUT DIABETES. DEPRESSION CAN INCREASE THE RISK OF DIABETES COMPLICATIONS, INCLUDING HEART DISEASE, NERVE DAMAGE, AND EARLY DEATH.  PATIENTS WITH DIABETES WILL BE ROUTINELY SCREENED FOR DEPRESSION WHEN VISITING THE POKAGON HEALTH SERVICES CLINIC, AND THOSE SHOWING SIGNS OF DEPRESSION WILL BE REFERRED FOR ADDITIONAL SERVICES AS APPROPRIATE. POKAGON HEALTH SERVICES WILL ALSO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT DEPRESSION AND ITS RELATIONSHIP TO DIABETES THROUGH EDUCATIONAL HANDOUTS AND DURING COMMUNITY EVENTS, AND THE CLINIC TEAM WILL BE TRAINED ON RESOURCES AVAILABLE IN THE COMMUNITY TO HELP PATIENTS WITH DEPRESSION. IN ADDITION TO ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE BEST PRACTICE, POKAGON HEALTH SERVICES WILL SEEK TO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT DIABETES IN THE POKAGON COMMUNITY AND PROVIDE SERVICES AND EVENTS FOCUSED ON GOOD NUTRITION. THESE ACTIVITIES/SERVICES WILL INCLUDE THE ANNUAL LIGHT THE WAY 5K DIABETES NIGHT-TIME RUN HELD IN NOVEMBER DURING DIABETES AWARENESS MONTH; EDUCATION ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF BREASTFEEDING AND SUPPORT FOR LACTATING MOTHERS; CONSULTING ON HEALTHY MEALS FOR ELDERS LUNCHES AND CHILDREN AND YOUTH PROGRAMS; AND AN ANNUAL BABY CELEBRATION TO HONOR BABIES BORN THE PREVIOUS YEAR, WHICH INCLUDES EDUCATION ON BREASTFEEDING, POSTPARTUM DEPRESSION, HEALTHY EATING, AND OTHER TOPICS. IN IMPLEMENTING THE SDPI PROGRAM, POKAGON HEALTH SERVICES WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER TRIBAL GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS, THE HEALTHY START/HOME VISITING PROGRAM UTILIZING THE FAMILY SPIRIT CURRICULUM, INTER-TRIBAL COUNCIL OF MICHIGAN, THE CASSOPOLIS COUNCIL ON AGING, AND THE VAN BUREN AND CASS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENTS.
PREVENTION OF DIABETES IN THE COMMUNITY OF SANTA CLARA PUEBLO

PUEBLO OF ACOMA SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS - THE PUEBLO OF ACOMA SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM OF INDIANS (POA SDPI) IS A CRITICAL SERVICE THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS DEPARTMENT PROVIDES TO THE ACOMA COMMUNITY. THE SERVICES INCLUDE PERSON-CENTERED CARE BY COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS WHO HELP PATIENTS MONITOR SEVERAL ASPECTS OF HEALTH THAT IMPACT THE HEALTH OUTCOME OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DIABETES. SOME OF THE SERVICES INCLUDE: MONITORING OF GLUCOSE LEVELS AND BMI VIA HOME VISITS, GARNERING SUPPORT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH NURSE, AS NEEDED, AND PROVIDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH DIABETES EDUCATION EVENTS THAT FOCUS ON NUTRITION, COOKING AND MENTAL WELLNESS. THE COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS ARE SUPPORTED BY THE WELLNESS STAFF WHO OFFER INDIVIDUALIZED TRAINING AND EXERCISE SUPPORT THROUGH THE POA FITNESS CENTER. THE WELLNESS STAFF ALSO OFFER COMMUNITY FITNESS ACTIVITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY INCLUDING FUN RUNS AND COMMUNITY SPORTING EVENTS (SOFTBALL, VOLLEYBALL, ZUMBA CLASSES, ETC.). THE POA SDPI PROGRAM IS ESSENTIAL AS WE EMERGE FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND ALL ACTIVITIES AND INTERVENTIONS WILL BE APPROACHED FROM A HOLISTIC HEALTH PERSPECTIVE AS WE WORK TO HELP THE ACOMA COMMUNITY ACHIEVE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE.

THE COCHITI SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM ADDRESSES DIABETES MANAGEMENT, PREVENTION, DIAGNOSING, AS WELL AS EDUCATING THE PUEBLO DE COCHITI COMMUNITY ABOUT THE DISEASE. - 2023 PUEBLO DE COCHITI SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM PUEBLO DE COCHITI HAS ALLOCATED A COMMUNITY DIRECTED SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 2001. THE EFFORTS AND PREVENTION SERVICES PROVIDED HAVE MADE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON THE AWARENESS, INTERVENTION, AND TREATMENT TECHNIQUES OF THE DISEASE WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. THE NUMBER OF DIAGNOSED PATIENTS REMAINS STEADILY BASED ON THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE DIABETES AUDIT. BASED ON THE RECENT SDPI AUDIT, BEST PRACTICES, GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, ACTIVITIES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND NEEDS ASSESSMENT THE 2023 APPLICATION WILL FOCUS ON OVERWEIGHT, NUTRITION EDUCATION, AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY. DUE TO THE ONGOING COVID-19 PANDEMIC, IT HAS BEEN HIGHLY REQUESTED OF THE PROGRAM TO PROVIDE WEIGHT MANAGEMENT EDUCATION, NUTRITION EDUCATION, AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AVENUES TO THE COMMUNITY. THE BEST PRACTICES CAN BE SIMULTANEOUSLY ADDRESSED DURING EVENTS AND EDUCATIONAL CLASSES VIA DISTANCE LEARNING OR IN LIMITED IN-PERSON GATHERINGS. DUE TO THE ONGOING COVID-19 PANDEMIC, ACCESS TO COMMUNITY PATIENTS HAS BEEN LIMITED TO VIRTUAL CLASSES OR LIMITED IN-PERSON MEETINGS.

SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS (SDPI) - THE PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBAL GOVERNMENT—ONE OF THE NINETEEN PUEBLOS STILL IN EXISTENCE IN NEW MEXICO. THE PUEBLO IS LOCATED ON THE MEADOW MESAS AND CANYON SYSTEMS OF THE EASTERN JEMEZ MOUNTAINS OF NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO. THE POPULATION OF SAN ILDEFONSO IS APPROXIMATELY 820 PEOPLE. THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES (IHS) SANTA FE SERVICE UNIT HOSPITAL AND THE SANTA CLARA CLINIC PROVIDED A WIDE RAGE OF MEDICAL SERVICES TO THE PUEBLO'S RESIDENTS.  ACCORDING TO THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC), APPROXIMATELY 86 MILLION AMERICANS AGE 20 AND OLDER (37%) HAVE PREDIABETES (I.E., BLOOD GLUCOSE LEVELS HIGHER THAN NORMAL BUT NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO BE DIAGNOSED WITH DIABETES) AND 90% OF THOSE WITH PREDIABETES DO NOT KNOW THEY HAVE IT. OBESITY IS STRONGLY ASSOCIATED WITH BOTH TYPE 2 DIABETES AND PREDIABETES. INTERVENTIONS TO PREVENT OR DELAY THE DEVELOPMENT OF TYPE 2 DIABETES HAVE THE POTENTIAL BOTH TO IMPROVE INDIVIDUAL HEALTH AND QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH DISEASE AVOIDANCE (E.G., EYE, KIDNEY, AND NERVE DAMAGE; STROKES; HEART ATTACKS) AND TO SAVE THE HEALTH CARE SYSTEM SUBSTANTIAL MEDICAL COSTS BY REDUCING THE INCIDENCE OF TYPE 2 DIABETES AND ITS ASSOCIATED COMPLICATIONS. WITHOUT SUCH INTERVENTIONS, IT IS ESTIMATED THAT 15-30% OF INDIVIDUALS WITH PREDIABETES WILL DEVELOP TYPE 2 DIABETES MELLITUS (DM) WITHIN FIVE YEARS.  IN MOST OF THE STUDIES CONDUCTED WITH ADULT AI/NAS, PREVALENCE RATES OF OBESITY/OVERWEIGHT ARE HIGHER THAN THE RESPECTIVE U.S RATES FOR ALL RACES COMBINED, WITH NATIVE AMERICANS BEING TWICE AS LIKELY AS WHITES TO HAVE TYPE 2 DIABETES. LIFESTYLE CHANGES TO REDUCE OBESITY AND OBESITY-RELATED INFLAMMATION HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO REDUCE SYMPTOM BURDEN IN THIS POPULATION.  LIFESTYLE INTERVENTIONS DELIVERED VIA MOBILE APPLICATIONS ARE ON THE RISE IN ORDER TO PROVIDE LOW COST, PERSONALIZED OPTIONS THAT CAPITALIZE ON EFFORTS TO PROMOTE SELF-MANAGEMENT AND HEALTH BEHAVIOR CHANGE. SELF-MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES (E.G., HEALTHY DIET AND EXERCISE), AS PART OF A LIFESTYLE INTERVENTION, HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH IMPROVED OUTCOMES IN CANCER POPULATIONS; HOWEVER, THESE PROGRAMS RARELY INCLUDED PERSONALIZATION TO PATIENTS’ PREFERENCES, AND HAVE HAD LIMITED SUCCESS IN DEMONSTRATING LONG-TERM ADOPTION OF HEALTH BEHAVIORS.  OUT OF 820 PEOPLE, ABOUT 47 PEOPLE HAVE A DOCUMENTED DIAGNOSIS OF DIABETES. THESE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH A DIAGNOSIS OF DIABETES ARE IN A DIRE NEED ACCESS TO PHYSICAL ACTIVITY PARTICIPATION AND EDUCATION, BETTER NUTRITIONAL EDUCATION, BETTER MONITORING OF CARDIOVASCULAR RISK FACTORS SUCH AS HYPERTENSION, POOR NUTRITION, STRESS, TOBACCO USE, AND MEDICATION ROUTINE ADHERENCE.  ABOUT THE NEED ASSESSMENT OR USER POPULATION, ESTIMATED 679 AMERICAN INDIAN/ALASKAN NATIVE RECEIVED HEALTH SERVICES FROM LOCAL IHS CLINICS, OUT OF WHICH 35 WERE DIABETICS.  IN PREVENTING AND/OR TREATMENT OF DIABETES AT SAN ILDEFONSO PUEBLO, THERE ARE FOUR COMMON CHALLENGES, WHICH HAS BEEN QUITE COMMON IN THE PAST. THESE CHALLENGES INCLUDE: (A) RECRUITING AND RETENTION OF QUALIFIED STAFF, (B) PATIENT PARTICIPATION, (C) TRANSPORTATION, AND (D) PERCEPTION OF INEVITABILITY OF DEVELOPING DIABETES NO MATTER WHAT THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS DO.  FOR FY23, SAN ILDEFONSO PUEBLO HAS CHOSEN “BLOOD PRESSURE CONTROL” AS THEIR BEST PRACTICE FOR SDPI PROGRAM WITH THE FOLLOWING PROPOSED ACTIVITIES OR SERVICES: (A) BIWEEKLY BLOOD PRESSURE CHECKS AND PROMOTING BLOOD PRESSURE SELF-MONITORING; (B) HYPERTENSION EDUCATION, (C) NUTRITION AND DIABETES EDUCATION, (D) PROVIDE ACCESS TO PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES/EDUCATION AND STRESS MANAGEMENT EDUCATION, (E) COMPLIANCE WITH MEDICATION, AND (F) OBESITY MANAGEMENT AND REDUCTION. BASED ON THESE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES, THIS BEST PRACTICE WILL TARGET A POPULATION OF 47 PEOPLE WITH THEIR AGES 40 AND ABOVE FOR TREATMENT. PATIENTS WITH DIABETES WHO HAVE BLOOD PRESSURE <140/<90 WILL ALSO BE ENCOURAGED TO FOLLOW THE LIFESTYLE MODIFICATION TO PREVENT THEM FROM GETTING HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE.

SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS - PUEBLO OF ZIA PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY  THE PUEBLO OF ZIA IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE LOCATED IN CENTRAL NEW MEXICO. ZIA PUEBLO SITS ATOP A MESA OVERLOOKING THE JEMEZ RIVER, 17 MILES NORTHWEST OF BERNALILLO ON HIGHWAY 550 AND 35 MILES NORTHWEST OF ALBUQUERQUE. ZIA PUEBLO IS ONE OF 19 PUEBLOS IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO, ONE OF SEVEN KERES SPEAKING PUEBLOS, ALSO KNOWN AS THE “HOME OF THE ZIA SUN SYMBOL.” ZIA PUEBLO SPANS MORE THAN 121,080 ACRES OF INDIAN LAND, 675 TRIBAL MEMBERS CURRENTLY LIVE ON THE RESERVATION. ZIA PUEBLO MEMBERS ARE STRONG, ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS IN THEIR TRADITIONAL CULTURAL/CUSTOMS, WELL-KNOWN ARTISANS FOR TRADITIONAL POTTERY MAKING. PUEBLO MEN GROW THEIR OWN VEGETABLES SUCH AS CHILI, CORN, SQUASH, WATERMELONS, ETC.  OUR PURPOSE IS TO SEEK RESOURCES NEEDED TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY-BASED NUTRITION EDUCATION, DIABETES RELATED EDUCATION/SERVICES, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EDUCATION AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ADDRESS DIABETES RELATED PROBLEMS, OBESITY, AND OTHER HEALTH ISSUES. SDPI FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO PROVIDE THESE SERVICES/EDUCATION TO THE ZIA COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AGE 7-85 YRS. OLD.  BASED ON THE NEEDS ASSESSMENT FROM COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND LEADERSHIP/ADMINISTRATION’S PARTICIPATION, OUR SELECTED BEST PRACTICE IS NUTRITION EDUCATION. THE TARGET POPULATION FOR THE BEST PRACTICE IS ZIA COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AGE 7-85, WHO HAVE DIABETES AND/OR AT RISK OF DEVELOPING DIABETES, LIVE ON/OFF RESERVATION AND ARE PROVIDED SERVICES/EDUCATION AT COMMUNITY EVENTS, IN THE CLINIC OR IN THE HOME. MEDIUM TO HIGH INTENSITY.  COLLABORATE WITH GLOBAL NUTRITION LLC TO PROVIDE NUTRITION PHONE CONSULTATIONS & ONE-ON-ONE/GROUP NUTRITION EDUCATION,  ZOOM HEALTHY SNACK MAKING IN COLLABORATION WITH ZIA HEALTH TASK FORCE & FIVE SANDOVAL PREVENTION PROGRAM, TRADITIONAL/WESTERN COOKING CLASSES IN COLLABORATION WITH THE ZIA LANGUAGE PROGRAM AND  HEALTH FAIRS WILL BE IN COLLABORATION WITH ZIA HEALTH CLINIC & OTHER HEALTH PROVIDERS. OUR MEASURE WILL BE THE NUMBER AND PERCENT OF INDIVIDUALS IN OUR TARGET GROUP WHO RECEIVE NUTRITION EDUCATION.  OTHER SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED FOR DIABETES RELATED EDUCATION THROUGH THE MAIL OUT PROCESS WITH EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND SELF-CARE PACKAGES FOR FOOT, EYE, DENTAL, MEDICATION, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, & STRESS MANAGEMENT. WE HOPE FOR BETTER DIABETES MANAGEMENT,  IMPROVED A1C NUMBERS AND MOVEMENT TO LESSEN SEDENTARY CONDITIONS.  PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EDUCATION/SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE FITNESS CENTER WITH PERSONAL TRAINING AND GROUP EXERCISE SUCH AS CHALLENGES, HIKING, RUN/WALKS, FAMILY FITNESS NIGHTS, ETC. TO DECREASE HEALTH RISK FACTORS IN THE COMMUNITY.  TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO GET TO THEIR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND CONTINUE GOOD HEALTH CARE SERVICES FOR OUR PEOPLE.  WE WILL USE COLLABORATION METHODS TO ASSURE EFFICIENT USE OF RESOURCES AND EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS.

SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS - THE PUEBLO OF POJOAQUE IS LOCATED WITHIN THE POJOAQUE VALLEY JUST 20 MILES NORTH OF THE NEW MEXICO STATE CAPITAL IN SANTA FE. THE TRIBE IS A SMALL TRIBE OF LESS THAN 600 MEMBERS. THE PUEBLO ADMINISTERS VARIOUS SOCIAL PROGRAMS WHICH ARE FUNDED WITH BOTH TRIBAL AND GOVERNMENTAL FUNDS. OF THESE PROGRAMS THE TRIBES DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY HEALTH MANAGES A SPECIAL DIABETES FOR INDIANS PROGRAM (SDPI). THIS PROGRAM IS CONSIDERED A COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAM AND COORDINATES MEDICAL SERVICES WITH MEDICAL ENTITIES FOR ITS MEMBERS. THE DIABETES PREVALENCE WITHIN THE TRIBE IS JUST BELOW THE NATIONAL AVERAGE AMONG NATIVE COMMUNITIES OF 17 PERCENT. THE TRIBES DIABETES PREVALENCE IS BETWEEN 15 TO 16 PERCENT. THIS MEANS THAT APPROXIMATELY 15-16 PERCENT OF THE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH DIABETES. WITH THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE THE SDPI PROGRAM HELPS ITS COMMUNITY IN VARIOUS WAYS TO BE AWARE OF THE SIGNS AND AFFECTS OF DIABETES AND HOW TO PREVENT THE DISEASE. IN ADDITION, FOR THOSE WHO ARE DIAGNOSED WITH THE DISEASE THE SDPI HELPS THEM MANAGE THEIR CONDITION. IN SOME CASES FOR THOSE WITH TYPE 1 DIABETES, THROUGH A CHANGE IN LIFE STYLE, DIET AND EXERCISE ARE ABLE TO CURE THEMSELVES OF THE DISEASE. THE CONTINUANCE OF THE FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THIS PROGRAM BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES VIA THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE WILL AFFORD THE POJOAQUE SDPI PROGRAM WITH THE RESOURCES TO CONTINUE HELPING ITS MEMBERS IN BATTLING THIS DREADFUL DISEASE. THESE MONIES WILL BE USED TO CONTINUE EDUCATION CLASSES IN DIABETES AWARENESS, NUTRITION, DIET AND EXERCISE. IN ADDITION, FUNDS ARE USED TO ENSURE THAT OUR MEMBERS HAVE ACCESS TO NEEDED MEDICAL EXAMS THAT DETECT THE ADVERSE AFFECTS OF THE DISEASE.

DIABETES PREVENTION PROGRAM - OWINGEH PUEBLO IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE LOCATED IN RIO ARRIBA COUNTY OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO. IT IS THE LARGEST OF TEWA SPEAKING PUEBLO'S WITH A POPULATION OF 2700 REGISTERED TRIBAL MEMBERS. ABOUT 1526 MEMBERS LIVE IN THE VILLAGE AND SURROUNDING AREA. THE LARGEST AGE GROUP IS 16-65 AND THE HIGHEST RISK FOR CHRONIC DISEASE. THE PROGRAM PROMOTES POSITIVE YOUTH AND ADULT SKILLS TO MAKE HEALTHY LIFESTYLE CHOICES.  WE ENCOURAGE MEMBERS TO BE ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS IN THEIR HEALTH BY OFFERING A BROAD RANGE OF PREVENTION SERVICES.  WE HAVE A FITNESS CENTER OPEN FOR 16YRS AND ABOVE WITH A VARIETY OF EQUIPMENT. SERVICES INCLUDE EXERCISE PLANS, CHALLENGES, ASSESSMENTS PRE AND POST ACTIVITY, PREVENTION EDUCATION(GROUP OR INDIVIDUAL AND FOOD DEMOS. WE HAVE THE STAFF TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY SCREENING OF BLOOD SUGARS, BLOOD PRESSURE AND NUTRITION COUNSELING. OUR OVERALL GOAL IS TO PREVENT THE ONSET OF TYPE 2 DIABETES AND TO EDUCATE THOSE WITH DIABETES SELF MANAGEMENT SKILLS.

UTE MOUNTAIN UTE TRIBE SPECIAL DIABETES PROJECT - THE UMUT IS REQUESTING $333,611 TO EXPAND AND ENHANCE ITS SLEEPING UTE MOUNTAIN SPECIAL DIABETES PREVENTION INITIATIVE IN 2023. THE PURPOSE OF THE FUNDING WILL BE TO EXPAND AND ENHANCE THE BEST PRACTICE OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, AS WELL AS INCREASE NUTRITION AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING THROUGH INCREASED COORDINATION OF SERVICES WITH OTHER TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS AND FOUNDATIONS. IN AUGUST 2022, THE DIABETES PROGRAM BEGAN WORKING WITH THE MOGUÁN BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CENTER AND TIWAHE INITIATIVE TO COORDINATE SERVICES THAT WILL INCLUDE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH EDUCATION IN NUTRITION AS WELL AS PROVIDE K-12 AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS. THESE COORDINATED PROGRAMS PROVED TO BE VERY SUCCESSFUL AND WE WANT TO EXPAND SIMILAR COLLABORATIONS IN 2023. MORE CLASSES OR PLANNED FOR 2023 WHERE THE DIABETES PROGRAM WILL COLLABORATE.

DIABETES PREVENTION AND TREATMENT PROJECT - BASED ON THE CANONCITO BAND OF NAVAJOS HEALTH CENTER (CBNHC) DATABASE THERE ARE 227 PATIENTS WITH DIABETES MELLITUS TYPE 2 AND 281 PATIENTS WITH PRE-DIABETES EMPANELED TO OUR HEALTH CENTER.   BLOOD PRESSURE IN CONTROL RATES FOR OUR PATIENTS WITH DIABETES MELLITUS TYPE 2 HAS BEEN LOW AT 54% AND 52% OVER THE LAST 2 YEARS ACCORDING TO OUR SDPI DIABETES AUDIT REPORTS.   BLOOD PRESSURE CONTROL REDUCES THE RISK FOR COMPLICATIONS FROM HYPERTENSION AND DIABETES SUCH AS CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE AND KIDNEY DISEASE.   CBNHC HAS SELECTED IMPROVING BLOOD PRESSURE IN CONTROL RATES FOR PATIENTS WITH DIABETES WHO LIVE IN THE COMMUNITY OF TO'HAJIILEE, NM AS THE SDPI BEST PRACTICE.  WITHIN THE HEALTH CENTER WE PLAN TO PROVIDE EDUCATION TO CLINICAL PROVIDERS ON THE IMPORTANCE OF CONTROLLING BLOOD PRESSURE WITH EVIDENCE BASED TREATMENT INCLUDING LIFESTYLE CHANGES AS WELL AS MEDICATION MANAGEMENT.  COMMUNITY OUTREACH WILL INVOLVE PROVIDING HOME BLOOD PRESSURE  MONITORS AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES AND CHALLENGES THAT ENCOURAGE EXERCISE, HEALTHY LOW SALT EATING AND WEIGHT LOSS.    OUR SECOND BEST PRACTICE WILL BE TO CONTINUE TO IMPROVE DM EYE CARE BY SCHEDULING ANNUAL EYE EXAMS AND PROVIDING PREVENTION EDUCATION OF EYE CARE.  OUR THIRD BEST PRACTICE WILL BE TO CONTINUE TO IMPROVE DIABETES FOOT CARE.  WE WILL HIRE A PODIATRIST FOR FOOT CARE AND WE WILL PROVIDE OUTREACH PREVENTION EDUCATION ON THE IMPORTANCE OF FOOT CARE AND GOOD DM CONTROL.

DIABETES RELATED EDUCATION - THE SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO KEWA HEALTH OUTREACH PROGRAM (KHOP) IS A TRIBAL PROGRAM THAT IS COMMUNITY-BASED. KHOP STARTED A PHYSICAL ACTIVITY FOCUSED DIABETES HEALTH PROGRAM IN 1999 AND HAS SINCE BEEN ABLE TO EXPAND COMMUNITY PARTNER REACH AND AVAILABLE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES WITH SDPI FUNDS. WE HAVE 23 YEARS OF DIABETES PREVENTION EDUCATION EXPERIENCE ADDRESSING RISK FACTORS OF DIABETES. SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO IS A DESIGNATED FOOD DESERT WITH LITTLE ACCESS TO FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES.  THE PUEBLO HAS 621 HOMES WITH OVER 5,500 RESIDENTS, OF WHOM KHOP WAS ABLE TO REACH 850 WITH PROGRAM ACTIVITIES AND REACHING ALL HOMES WITH HEALTH EDUCATION THROUGH MONTHLY NEWSLETTERS. THE DIABETES NEEDS ASSESSMENT SUMMARY HIGHLIGHTS THE NEED FOR EDUCATION AND SUPPORT FOR COMPLICATIONS FROM DIABETES (VISION LOSS, AMPUTATIONS, AND DENTAL ISSUES). ADDITIONAL RISK FACTORS OF DIABETES THAT EMERGED FROM THE ASSESSMENT IS NEEDING ASSISTANCE WITH ADDRESSING HYPERTENSION SYMPTOMS (DIZZINESS, VISION BLURRINESS, ETC.). THE COMMUNITY HAS HAD AN INCREASED NUMBER OF FALLS THAT LEAD TO INJURY DUE TO HYPERTENSION. THE DIABETES PREVALENCE ESTIMATE (B1.2) DOES NOT REPRESENT ACCURATE PREVALENCE ESTIMATIONS SINCE IT IS BASED ON SDHC DATA. MANY OF KEWA DIABETES PATIENTS CHOOSE TO SEEK PRIMARY CARE AT MEDICAL FACILITIES IN SANTA FE AND/OR ALBUQUERQUE (25-40 MILES DISTANCE). THE MORE ACCURATE DIABETES PREVALENCE CAN BE DRAWN FROM THE NM DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (NMDOH) COUNTY LEVEL DATA FOR AMERICAN INDIANS IN NEW MEXICO (NMDOH, 2022). THE DIABETES PREVALENCE OF DIABETES DEATHS (DEATHS PER 100,000 POPULATION, AGE-ADJUSTED, 2018-2020) IS LISTED AS 71.1 FOR AMERICAN INDIAN IN NM, COMPARED TO 26.9 FOR ALL RACES/ETHNICITIES IN NEW MEXICO, AND 22.6 COMPARED TO US WIDE DATA. THE 2022 AUDIT HIGHLIGHTED HIGHLIGHTS TYPE 2 DIABETES (96%), OBESITY (45%), AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY (21%) AND ISSUES THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED. KHOP HAS IDENTIFIED THE LACK OF NUTRITIOUS FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, LOCATION, AND OTHER CHALLENGES THAT HAVE IMPACTED THE SUCCESS OF OUR PROGRAM. KHOP CONTINUES TO EXPAND TRIBAL LEADERSHIP SUPPORT AND HAS EXPERIENCED MINIMAL STAFF TURNOVER WITHIN THE LAST GRANT PERIOD.

PICURIS PUEBLO SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS - THE PICURIS PUEBLO SDPI IS A TRIBAL PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES DIABETES MANAGEMENT AND PREVENTION EDUCATION. WE HAVE PROVIDED DIABETES PREVENTION SERVICES FOR OVER 20 YEARS. WE HAVE A PROGRAM COORDINATOR AND A FITNESS CENTER ATTENDANT. WITH THE HELP AND COLLABORATIONS FROM OTHER TRIBAL PROGRAMS, TRIBAL COUNCIL AND SOME VOLUNTEERS WE ARE ABLE TO PROVIDE A VARIETY OF ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS. THE OVERALL APPROACH AND OUTCOME OF OUR SDPI IS TO PROVIDE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EDUCATION AND ACTIVITIES IN HOPES TO REDUCE OBESITY AND ENCOURAGE MORE TRIBAL MEMBERS TO GET ACTIVE. WE INTRODUCE SAFE PRACTICES FOR HEALTHY LIFESTYLE CHANGES. WE HAVE DIFFERENT ACTIVITIES THAT TAKE PLACE DURING THE DIFFERENT SEASONS. FROM BIKING CLUBS FOR THE YOUTH TO RANGE OF MOTION CLASSES FOR THE ELDERS ARE SOME OF THE PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES THAT WE PROVIDE. ALL OF OUR ACTIVITIES ARE AGE APPROPRIATE FOR YOUTH, ADULTS, AND ELDERS. WE ARE THE SMALLEST PUEBLO WITH ABOUT 250 TRIBAL MEMBERS RESIDING ON THE RESERVATION IN RURAL NORTHER NEW MEXICO, WHICH ALLOWS US TO REACH ALMOST ALL OF THE POPULATION IN SOME WAY OR ANOTHER.  OUR PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH OUR LOCAL IHS FACILITY THROUGH TRAININGS THAT THEY PROVIDE AND ALLOCATING TIME FOR THEIR DIETICIAN TO COME TO OUR FACILITY TO HOST NUTRITION WORKSHOPS. OUR LOCAL IHS FACILITY IS ABOUT 45 MINUTES AWAY.

DIABETES SERVICES FOR NATIVE AMERICAN PEOPLE OF THE ALAMO NAVAJO COMMUNITY INCLUDING EDUCATION AND PREVENTION - THE SDPI PROGRAM IMPLEMENTED IN THE ALAMO COMMUNITY IS IN THE UNIQUE POSITION TO UTILIZE BOTH CLINICAL AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES FOR DIABETES EDUCATION, PREVENTION, AND TREATMENT.  PARTNERING WITH THE ALAMO COMMUNITY WELLNESS CENTER, THE SDPI PROGRAM PROVIDES GROUP CLASSES, EXERCISE OPPORTUNITIES AND TRAINING, COOKING CLASSES, AND DIABETES AWARENESS EVENTS.  IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE PRIMARY CARE CLINIC, THE SDPI PROGRAM ENSURES THAT BEST PRACTICES FOR DIABETES CARE IS MET FOR PATIENTS THROUGH UTILIZATION OF THE ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD TO MONITOR LIPID LEVELS, BLOOD GLUCOSE LEVELS, BLOOD PRESSURE, WEIGHT, FOOT AND EYE EXAMS, AMONG OTHERS.  THE ALAMO SDPI PROGRAM WILL ALSO BE FOCUSING ON DEPRESSION SCREENING TO ASSIST THE COMMUNITY WITH THE ONGOING STRESSORS RELATED TO CHRONIC DISEASE EXACERBATED BY THE CONTINUED STRESS OF A WORLD POST COIVD-19.

SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAMS FOR INDIANS - OBJECTIVE: THE ZUNI HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PROGRAM I.E. SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS (SDPI) HAS BEEN PROVIDING COMMUNITY-BASED INTERVENTIONS FOR DIABETES PREVENTION AND AWARENESS SINCE 1999. THE MISSION STATEMENT FOR THE ZUNI HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PROGRAM IS TO "IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE PEOPLE OF ZUNI BY PROMOTING HEALTHY LIVING THROUGH COOPERATION AND COLLABORATION WITH OTHER TRIBAL HEALTH AND NUTRITION RELATED PROGRAMS, SCHOOLS, ZUNI SERVICE UNIT OF INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES, COMMUNITY BUSINESSES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS." THE PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO ACCOMMODATE INDIVIDUALS WITH A BODY MASS INDEX (BMI) OF 30 AND/OR OVER AND A1C OF 9 OR HIGHER.  RESEARCH METHOD AND DESIGN: SO FAR IN 2022, THE ZUNI INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE UNIT HAS SERVED 7,734 OF THE ZUNI COMMUNITY, OF WHICH 1,658 ARE DIAGNOSED WITH TYPE II DIABETES RESULTING IN A PREVALENCE RATE OF 21.8%. THE ZUNI HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PROGRAM HAS SERVED 2,725 INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES, UP TO SEPTEMBER 2022, WHICH MEANS THE PROGRAM SERVED 35.2% OF THEIR ZUNI COMMUNITY MEMBERS. MANY OF THE INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE BEEN SERVED BY THE ZUNI HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PROGRAM WITHIN THIS YEAR, ARE EITHER DIABETIC,OR PRE-DIABETIC, OR AT RISK FOR DIABETES (DEFINED AS HAVING A BMI GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 30 OR A1C LEVELS OF 9 OR HIGHER).  CONCLUSION: THE ZUNI HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PROGRAM HAS CLOSELY EVALUATED EACH INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS PARTICIPATED IN THE COMMUNITY EVENTS. THE PREVALENCE OF TYPE II DIABETES STILL BEING HIGH, THE CONTINUATION OF AWARENESS, PREVENTION, AND MANAGEMENT IS NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF THE ZUNI COMMUNITY. WITH THE CONTINUED PROMOTION OF HEALTHY BEHAVIORS, HEALTH EDUCATION, AND PHYSICAL FITNESS ACTIVITIES, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND COMMUNITY-WIDE INTERVENTIONS, THE ZUNI HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE ZUNI COMMUNITY.

YSLETA DEL SUR PUEBLO DIABETES PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT PROGRAM - ADOPTION AND MAINTENANCE OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND PLANNED EXERCISE HAS MANY BENEFITS FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DIABETES AND PRE-DIABETES.  IT IMPROVES BLOOD GLUCOSE IN TYPE 2 DIABETES, WEIGHT LOSS, AND JOINT MOBILITY FOR OLDER ADULTS (COLBERG ET AL., 2016).  ACCORDING TO THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR CHRONIC DISEASE PREVENTION AND HEALTH PROMOTION, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY HELPS IMPROVE OVERALL HEALTH, FITNESS, AND QUALITY OF LIFE BUT ALSO HELPS REDUCE THE RISK FOR CONDITIONS LIKE TYPE 2 DIABETES, HEART DISEASE, DEPRESSION, ANXIETY, AND DEMENTIA IN OLDER ADULTS.  THE EVIDENCE SHOWS THAT PHYSICAL ACTIVITY PROMOTES BETTER FUNCTION AND SLEEP PATTERNS AND FOSTERS GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT. SELECTION OF THIS BEST PRACTICE WILL HELP THE PROGRAM EXPAND AND WORK TOWARDS INCREASING COMMUNITY-WIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR EXERCISE LIKE CULTURAL HIKES TO TRIBAL HISTORIC SITES OR CULTURAL PRACTICES LIKE THE ANNUAL FOOT RACES. AN EXAMPLE OF ONE RECOMMENDATION FOR IMPROVEMENT AS PER THE RESULTS OF THE SDPI EVALUATION.  ADDRESSING CULTURE AS A DETERMINANT OF HEALTH IS IMPORTANT.  " INVESTING IN NATIVE AMERICAN-LED STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY FROM THE HISTORICAL PERSPECTIVE OF CHANGES TO THE ENVIRONMENT, CULTURE, AND CONNECTION TO THE LAND MAY ADDRESS THE ROOT CAUSES OF OBESITY (WARNE & ROANHORSE, 2015).  COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION CAN STRENGTHEN OUR PROGRAM'S PRESENCE BY HELPING TRIBAL MEMBERS LEARN PHYSICAL ACTIVITY GUIDELINES FOR DIFFERENT AGE GROUPS. IN ADDITION, CONNECTING PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EDUCATION TO EXERCISE OPPORTUNITIES CAN HELP THE COMMUNITY GAIN SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE TO BECOME ACTIVE.  ULTIMATELY, BEING ADVOCATES FOR THEIR OWN HEALTH.  THE PROGRAM'S INVOLVEMENT IN DEVELOPING THE NEW HEALTH CLINIC WILL BRING ADDITIONAL BENEFITS, SUCH AS HIRING AN EXERCISE PROFESSIONAL TO WORK ALONGSIDE THE PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE PLANNING OF A STRUCTURED PROGRAM FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION OF THOSE WITH PRE-DIABETES AND SECONDARY PREVENTION FOR PERSONS WITH D IABETES.
